Name: Shadows of an Uncounted Journey
Notes: The work was written for the multimedia project 'one thousand curves ten thousand colours', which brought together interactive acoustic and electronic music with computer-generated images. The initial spark for this project came from Marguerite Yourcenar's story, 'How Wang-Fo Was Saved', based on a Chinese legend.
Related Works: one thousand curves ten thousand colours
Long Description: Underlying the entire score is an intense awareness of the joy and the pain that are ever present in the life and ultimate transfiguration of an artistic genius. Lee's music unfolds into structures built upon short fragments that repeat and expand into larger shapes in a fan-like manner. The harmonies are bold and fresh, filled with unexpected yet completely convincing dramatic destinations.
Short Description: A piece for soprano, clarinet or bass clarinet, violin, piano, and soundfiles, part of the multimedia project 'one thousand curves ten thousand colours'.
